intro: Adyseton atlanticum, commonly known as the Atlantic adyseton, is a rare flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant has adapted to sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in dune or maritime environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
